With a sigh and heavy spark, Tucson leans up against the wall of the hull o=
f the tanker, and listens to the droning of its engine before turning his h=
ead in the direction of Perseus, simply by following the volume of his voic=
e.  

" How many times I've fought in situations as yours.  I fought to pre=
serve and protect as the Decepticons fought to devour and destroy. After he=
aring your story Lord Perseus, I'd like to make it a mission of mine to hel=
p you bring the Maximal factions together as one as it should be naturally.=
  The Autobots fought as one, and like you, I too aspire to see peace repla=
ce war.  Primus would have wanted it to remain as such as he intended the A=
utobots to be many years ago.  We are no different.  In all we are all of o=
ne spark.  I for one wish to keep it that way."

He had remembered one arti=
fact that he had saved from Atlantis, a tiny compass that in his blindness,=
 was able to restore to working order. Finally, he could feel that the need=
le inside the compass, was staying in one place.  It had symbolic meaning. =
 it meant that for once Tucson knew what direction to take in his own exist=
ance and not feel completely lost, as he had upon coming back online from h=
is damages.  It makes him smile, as he gently puts it down on the dashboard=
 between himself and Lord Perseus.

" For a long time the needle in the com=
pass would not stay in one place, when I held it.  To me it meant that my e=
xistance was not on a sure path as I would have liked it to be.  So for the=
 longest time, I thought that coming to Atlantis would put me back on the r=
ight path eventually.  The needle is now still when I hold it, and is still=
 now.  In a way, I've found the right path and for the first time since I c=
ame back online, I know why my spark was spared.  The reason is here, in th=
is air tanker, in the path we're taking.  Thank you for allowing me to join=
 you.  If you hadn't extended your hand in kindness, I would not have found=
 the path I've been looking for, since my arrival on Atlantis years ago." 
=

He cracks his knuckles.

" By the way, if Razorwing is less than hospitabl=
e with you, I'll be sure to remind him where his roots eminate from.  I'm s=
ure he wouldn't want to get an Autobot upset would he?"
